issue.title: The definition of 'object state' applies only to class types

discussion.p: The definition of 'object state' applies only to class types, implying that fundamental types and arrays do not have this property.
Proposed change: Replacing "an object state" with "a value of an object" in and dropping the definition of "object state" in .
Accepted as Immediate to resolve NB comment.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4640.

p.del: the current value of all non-static class members of an object (9.2) [Note: The state of an object can be obtained by using one or more observer functions. — end note]
